title: Introduction to Quality Control Tools
headline: The free online course on quality control tools for data collection and interpretation, as well as the six sigma concept
description: This free online introduction to quality control tools will teach you about the seven quality tools used when carrying out data collection and interpretation, as well as the different types of quality control charts.You will also learn about the components of six sigma and the methodology used in six sigma, as well as the ways to assess service quality. This course will also teach you about the concept of different combination layouts.

courseDescription:
In this course, you will learn about the seven quality tools that are used when carrying out data collection and interpretation, as well as how these tools aid in decision making. The concept of acceptance sampling, statistical quality control and the different types of quality control charts will also be covered in this course. Then, the course will teach you about the single-sampling and double-sampling plans, as well as the diagrammatic form of the sampling plan.

This course will also introduce you to six sigma, as well as teach you about the components of six sigma and the methodology used in six sigma. Furthermore, this course will teach you about the ways to assess service quality and then look at the strategic resources of an organization. Lastly, this course will teach you about the concept of combination layouts, as well as the various ways for designing product layouts.

This course is helpful for learners who want to gain an understanding of the various tools that are used in quality control to collect and interpret data. The course is also helpful when learners want to understand the importance of acceptance sampling and the ways plans or products can be sampled. Begin this course now to learn about the importance of quality control tools in product maintenance management.

Start Course Now

  • Lesson Summary
    • The following quality control tools aid data collection and interpretation, and also provide the basis for decision making:
      - Flowcharts
      - Check Sheets
      - Histograms
      - Pareto Charts
      - Scatter Diagram
      - Control Chart
      - Cause-and-Effect Diagram
    • A flow chart is a visual representation of a process. It is a diagram of the steps in a process. 
    • A check sheet is a tool for organizing and collecting data, tally of problems or other events by category. 
    • Histograms are useful in getting a sense of the distribution of observed values. 
    • The Pareto chart classifies problem areas according to the degree of importance. 
    • Scatter diagrams are useful in deciding if there is a correlation between the values of two variables. 
    • Control chart is a statistical chart of the time-ordered values of a sample statistic. 
    • There are two natures of a sampling plan, which are:
      - Single Sampling Plan
      - Double or Multiple Sampling Plan
  • Learning Outcomes
  • Having completed this module, you should be able to:
    • Discuss the concept of six sigma and the components of six sigma. 
    • Identify some current issues in quality management. 
    • Discuss the definition and structure of quality function deployment. 
    • Explain the facilities layout under strategic resource organization. 
    • Identify the advantages and disadvantages of product layouts. 
    • Explain line balancing under designing product layouts.

  • Lesson Summary
    • The six sigma is a business process for improving quality, reducing costs, and increasing customer satisfaction.
    • The six sigma components are divided in two:
      - Management Component
      - Technical Component
    • Six sigma employs many statistical tool in a systematic project oriented fashion through the DMAIC cycle, which stands for:
      - Define
      - Measure
      - Analyze
      - Improve
      - Control
    • DPMO is a metric used to describe the variability of a process. 
    • SERVQUAL is an instrument designed to obtain feedback on an organization's ability to provide quality service to customers. 
    • The structure of quality function deployment is based on a set of matrices. 
  • Lesson Summary
    • The six sigma is a business process for improving quality, reducing costs, and increasing customer satisfaction.
    • The six sigma components are divided in two:
      - Management Component
      - Technical Component
    • Six sigma employs many statistical tool in a systematic project oriented fashion through the DMAIC cycle, which stands for:
      - Define
      - Measure
      - Analyze
      - Improve
      - Control
    • DPMO is a metric used to describe the variability of a process. 
    • SERVQUAL is an instrument designed to obtain feedback on an organization's ability to provide quality service to customers. 
    • The structure of quality function deployment is based on a set of matrices.
